ovdesc.p: The purpose of this table is to define rules for determining the default statement frequency when opening new Accounts.

When a new Account is opened, an Account Statement record, specifying the date and frequency for printing Account statements, is generated automatically by the system. This record may subsequently be amended manually, if required.

The default frequency is determined on the basis of Customer and Account details such as Residence, Sector and Account Category. The criteria used and their order of priority are specified in the CONDITION.PRIORITY file in the record whose ID is STATEMENT. A maximum of 4 fields may be used. Only the fields selected in the CONDITION.PRIORITY file are included Statement General Condition records.

The default statement frequency may be Daily (every working day), Monthly, Quarterly or Six.Monthly. Each Statement General Condition record specifies the various combinations of field values defining all Accounts with a particular default statement frequency.
If the details of an Account do not match the conditions specified in any Statement General Condition record, a default statement frequency of Monthly is used.
All internal Accounts have a default statement frequency of Monthly.

If the details of an Account match more than one Statement General Condition record, the Priority order is used to determine the default frequency. (The higher Priority field with a match wins. Priority 1 is the highest Priority.)

In order to stop production of Account Statements for specific Accounts, a record may be created with id 'NOSTMT' which will set PRINT.STATEMENT field as 'NO' in the respective Account Statement records.

Identifies whether the statement due date is to be set up according to the anniversary of the opening date or the period end date.

This field is used to determine whether when opening a new customer account the first due date for the statement should be either from the anniversary of the opening of the account or the period end date. For period end date, the end date depends upon the key of the record -

KEY DUE DATE Monthly Calendar end date of the month. Quarterly Calendar end date for the end of March, June, September or December. Six.Monthly Calendar end date for the end of June or December. Yearly Calendar end date for the end of December.
